Discovering North Sudan

Up until 2011 Sudan was the largest country in Africa, with its Northern half being made up of mostly desert. To the West are the great rolling sand dunes of the Libyan Desert and to the East is the Nubian Desert with relief in the form of the Nile - the White and the Blue Nile which converge in Khartoum and head on up to Egypt and eventually the sea.

Visit Us To Know More
